input: TSH: 0.1 µIU/mL, T3: 250 ng/dL, T4: 14 µg/dL
output:
Interpretation: Suppressed TSH with elevated T3/T4 indicates hyperthyroidism.
Clinical significance: Thyroid overactivity causing increased metabolism.
Future risks: Arrhythmias, osteoporosis, weight loss.
Lifestyle & follow-up: Beta-blocker if symptomatic; endocrinology referral; monitor thyroid function in 4–6 weeks.

input: TSH: 6.2 µIU/mL, T3: 90 ng/dL, T4: 4.9 µg/dL
output:
Interpretation: Elevated TSH with low-normal T3/T4 indicates hypothyroidism.
Clinical significance: Thyroid underactivity; slowed metabolism.
Future risks: Fatigue, weight gain, cardiac complications.
Lifestyle & follow-up: Levothyroxine therapy if symptomatic; repeat thyroid panel in 6–8 weeks; monitor heart rate and weight.

input: TSH: 3.0 µIU/mL, T3: 110 ng/dL, T4: 7 µg/dL
output:
Interpretation: All thyroid parameters within normal range.
Clinical significance: Euthyroid state; normal thyroid function.
Future risks: Minimal.
Lifestyle & follow-up: Maintain healthy diet; routine thyroid testing yearly.

input: TSH: 0.4 µIU/mL, T3: 210 ng/dL, T4: 12 µg/dL
output:
Interpretation: Low-normal TSH with elevated T3/T4 suggests early hyperthyroidism.
Clinical significance: Increased thyroid hormone activity.
Future risks: Cardiac arrhythmias, bone loss.
Lifestyle & follow-up: Monitor thyroid function; endocrinology consultation; avoid excessive iodine supplements.

input: TSH: 7.1 µIU/mL, T3: 85 ng/dL, T4: 5 µg/dL
output:
Interpretation: Elevated TSH with low T4 suggests primary hypothyroidism.
Clinical significance: Reduced thyroid hormone production.
Future risks: Fatigue, constipation, weight gain.
Lifestyle & follow-up: Start levothyroxine; retest thyroid function in 6–8 weeks; monitor symptoms.

input: TSH: 0.05 µIU/mL, T3: 300 ng/dL, T4: 15 µg/dL
output:
Interpretation: Suppressed TSH with markedly elevated T3/T4 indicates overt hyperthyroidism.
Clinical significance: Thyroid gland overproduction of hormones.
Future risks: Thyrotoxicosis, atrial fibrillation, osteoporosis.
Lifestyle & follow-up: Immediate endocrinology referral; beta-blockers for symptom control; monitor liver function if on antithyroid drugs.

input: TSH: 5.5 µIU/mL, T3: 95 ng/dL, T4: 5.2 µg/dL
output:
Interpretation: Mildly elevated TSH with low-normal T4 indicates subclinical hypothyroidism.
Clinical significance: Early thyroid underactivity; often asymptomatic.
Future risks: Progression to overt hypothyroidism, lipid abnormalities.
Lifestyle & follow-up: Monitor thyroid function every 3–6 months; consider levothyroxine if symptomatic.

input: TSH: 1.8 µIU/mL, T3: 100 ng/dL, T4: 7.5 µg/dL
output:
Interpretation: Normal thyroid function.
Clinical significance: Euthyroid; metabolism stable.
Future risks: Minimal.
Lifestyle & follow-up: Routine annual thyroid check; maintain balanced diet.

input: TSH: 0.2 µIU/mL, T3: 220 ng/dL, T4: 13 µg/dL
output:
Interpretation: Low TSH with high T3/T4 indicates hyperthyroidism.
Clinical significance: Increased metabolic activity due to overactive thyroid.
Future risks: Palpitations, weight loss, bone thinning.
Lifestyle & follow-up: Endocrinology evaluation; monitor heart rate; avoid excess iodine.

input: TSH: 8.0 µIU/mL, T3: 80 ng/dL, T4: 4.5 µg/dL
output:
Interpretation: High TSH with low T4 suggests hypothyroidism.
Clinical significance: Reduced thyroid hormone output.
Future risks: Bradycardia, fatigue, hyperlipidemia.
Lifestyle & follow-up: Initiate levothyroxine therapy; retest in 6–8 weeks; monitor cardiovascular health.

input: TSH: 2.5 µIU/mL, T3: 105 ng/dL, T4: 6.8 µg/dL
output:
